qas.question: What building does the Detroit Symphony Orchestra play in?
What family purchased the Detroit opera House?
How many seats does the Fisher Theater have?
In what year was the Detroit Opera House purchased?

context: Major theaters in Detroit include the Fox Theatre (5,174 seats), Music Hall (1,770 seats), the Gem Theatre (451 seats), <a3_0>Masonic Temple Theatre<a3_0/> (4,404 seats), the Detroit Opera House (2,765 seats), the Fisher Theatre (<a2_0>2,089<a2_0/> seats), The Fillmore Detroit (2,200 seats), Saint Andrew's Hall, the Majestic Theater, and <a0_0>Orchestra Hall<a0_0/> (2,286 seats) which hosts the renowned Detroit Symphony Orchestra. The Nederlander Organization, the largest controller of Broadway productions in New York City, originated with the purchase of the Detroit Opera House in <a4_0>1922<a4_0/> by the <a1_0>Nederlander<a1_0/> family.
